newsitem.title: HUNGARY: CSFB reduces Hungary C/A def forecast to 4.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: CSFB reduces Hungary C/A def forecast to 4.6 pct.

text.p: Credit Suisse First Boston said Hungary's C/A deficit was lower than expected early this year and revised its C/A deficit forecast for 1997 downwards to 4.6 percent from 5.2 percent.
"The current account deficit fell surprisingly, due to a sharp pickup in merchandise exports...and in the savings ratio," CSFB said in a weekly update on European emerging markets.
It said Hungarian merchandise exports were up 42 percent year on year in the first two months based on sales for car components, microelectronics and pharmaceutical products.
"Our forecast for (GDP) growth remains three percent...however we have reduced our current account deficit/GDP forecast from 5.2 percent to 4.6 percent," CSFB said.
